history.content: It depends on your appointment (how many hours). You get to indicate how many hours/week you prefer to work, so plan accordingly!

I was a reader for EE16A in the past. I'm not sure what exactly being a reader this summer will entail, but if it's the same as in previous semesters, then other than attending a reader meeting once a week, your work is really done on your own time.

In other words, you're given a task of grading a certain amount of homeworks, and you can do that grading whenever you want during the week, whether it's at 1pm or 3am. So in terms of time conflicts, you'll probably fine. 

If you want to go above and beyond, you can ask to help out at homework parties or with office hours, so that would also be at a particular time.

In terms of whether you could manage doing both an internship and being a reader, that really depends on your internship and how much free time you're going to find. I found that at my internship last summer, I had quite a bit of free time compared to Berkeley. So if you wanted to fill fill some of that time with reading for a class, you could.
How much work is being a reader in summer for CS 70 or EE16A? Is it feasible to be on course staff despite having an internship during the day?
history.subject: Reader with an Internship
